content:
Diagnosis:	Locally advanced non-small cell lung cancer (adenocarcinoma)

Management:	15 Mar 2024 Started on Osimertinib 80mg daily

Histology:	Stage IIIB (T4N2M0) adenocarcinoma with EGFR T790M mutation

Current Situation:	Review at 4 weeks of targeted therapy

I reviewed [redacted name] today in the lung oncology clinic. She has completed 4 weeks of Osimertinib therapy for locally advanced EGFR-mutated lung adenocarcinoma. Her initial presenting symptoms of cough and breathlessness have shown marked improvement. Performance status has improved from 2 to 1. She reports grade 1 diarrhea which is manageable without medication, and mild fatigue which improves with rest.

On examination, there is improved air entry in the right lung field compared to previous review, though some residual dullness persists at the base. No peripheral edema or clubbing noted.

Blood tests show stable renal and liver function. The plan is to continue with Osimertinib at current dose and arrange CT chest/abdomen/pelvis in 4 weeks' time to assess response. We will review her again with imaging results. I have provided contact details for the lung cancer nurse specialist should she develop any concerning symptoms in the interim.

patient_facts.value: Improved air entry in right lung field with some residual dullness at base

status_updates.value: Locally advanced EGFR-mutated lung adenocarcinoma. Showing clinical improvement after 4 weeks of Osimertinib
CT chest/abdomen/pelvis in 4 weeks to assess response
